title: Cover blown: How Pakistani 'Priya Sharma' lured Navy clerk to leak Op Sindoor secrets
content: Intelligence agencies arrested Vishal Yadav, a Naval Headquarters UDC, for allegedly spying for Pakistan, receiving payments through bank transfers and cryptocurrency. His activities surfaced during a review of Facebook accounts flagged in a 2022 espionage case. Yadav shared sensitive military information, including updates on military operations, and received payments ranging from Rs 5,000 to Rs 50,000.

title: Kolkata shocker: Victim alleges rape was videotaped; what initial probe revealed
content: Kolkata Police reported the arrest of Manujit Mishra, a former Trinamool Congress Chhatra Parishad leader, for allegedly raping a law student within college premises. Mishra, also a temporary staff member and lawyer, is accused of filming the assault and threatening to release it.

title: 'I think it's important': Why India didn't sign SCO joint release? EAM gives 'context'
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar supported Defence Minister Rajnath Singh's decision to abstain from signing a joint statement at the SCO Defence Ministers' meeting in China. Jaishankar emphasized that the SCO's primary objective is to combat terrorism. However, one member nation blocked any reference to terrorism in the outcome document.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Sir, don't bowl ...' - Siraj slammed after opening Test defeat
content: Mohammad Kaif has criticised Mohammed Siraj's bowling performance in the first Test against England, where India suffered a five-wicket defeat. Kaif emphasized the need for Siraj to bowl with his mind and focus on line and length to take wickets. He also highlighted how England strategically attacked the other bowlers, while playing defensively against Bumrah, ultimately leading to their victory.

title: Violence over power cut in Greater Noida society: Residents assaulted by security guards
content: A violent confrontation erupted at Supertech Eco Village 1 in Greater Noida West when residents, frustrated by a prolonged power outage, were allegedly assaulted by security and maintenance staff. The dispute escalated from a peaceful complaint to physical violence, with residents reportedly being beaten with sticks and batons.

title: America‚Äôs China threat: Huawei‚Äôs new laptop fuels debate on US sanctions
content: Huawei's new MateBook Fold uses a SMIC-made 7nm chip, showcasing China's tech self-reliance amid U.S. sanctions. Despite this, China lags behind TSMC's advanced chip technology. U.S. restrictions hinder China's access to cutting-edge chipmaking tools and AI chips, intensifying competition in the tech sector. China is pinning its hopes on Huawei and SMIC for advanced chipmaking.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Science in madness' - Vaughan leads praise for Pant's heroics
content: Rishabh Pant's spectacular twin centuries at Headingley, though insufficient to secure an Indian victory, have garnered widespread acclaim, with Michael Vaughan highlighting his "game-changer" status and deep cricketing intelligence. Despite Pant's heroics, India's fragile lower order and inconsistent bowling led to a five-wicket defeat for India.

title: India slaps 27-63% anti-dumping duties on these goods from China, Taiwan
content: India has levied anti-dumping duties on plastic processing machines. These machines originate from China and Taiwan. The duties range from 27% to 63%. This action follows evidence of unfair pricing. The move aims to protect Indian manufacturers. It addresses the harm caused by dumped imports. The duties will remain for five years.

title: Exclusive: Gukesh vs Carlsen not happening in Vegas; why is world champion not playing?
content: World Champion D Gukesh will not be playing in the Las Vegas leg of the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam, citing exhaustion after Norway Chess. Vidit Gujrathi will replace him, donning Gukesh‚Äôs red jacket. The $750,000 event runs July 16‚Äì20 at Wynn Las Vegas. Meanwhile, the India leg in September is cancelled, and Jan Henric Buettner will step down as CEO on July 1.

title: Who is MacKenzie Scott; Jeff Bezos‚Äô ex-wife & one of world‚Äôs richest woman activist
content: Jeff Bezos is set to marry Lauren S√°nchez in a grand Venice wedding this week, attended by celebrities like Kim Kardashian and Bill Gates. This marks a new chapter for Bezos after his 25-year marriage to MacKenzie Scott, which ended in 2019.

title: ‚ÄòFall to death‚Äô: Video of Harihar fort over-congested with tourists goes viral
content: A viral video shows a large crowd trekking to Harihar Fort in Maharashtra. The fort is known for its dangerous trail. The video raises concerns about safety and regulation. Social media users are worried about potential accidents. Some users are questioning the forest department's role. The incident has sparked a debate about managing tourist footfall in India.

title: ‚ÄòOn the pot during court‚Äô: Man attends Gujarat HC virtual hearing from toilet seat
content: A man attending a Gujarat High Court hearing via video conference was caught on camera seated on a toilet, triggering outrage. The incident occurred before Justice Nirzar S Desai's bench on June 20. This follows similar instances of inappropriate behavior in virtual courtrooms, including a litigant smoking.

title: 'Never say never': Paralympian Sheetal Devi drives car with feet - WATCH
content: Sheetal Devi, the Indian Paralympic archery star, inspires again by confidently driving a car using her feet, showcasing her unwavering spirit. Despite being born with phocomelia, she has defied limitations, achieving international success in para-archery. Her record-breaking performance at the Paris Paralympics and her ability to master new skills continue to inspire millions.

title: US government warns: Green Cards and Visas at risk; will be revoked if ...
content: USCIS has issued a stern warning, stating that immigrants risk losing their green cards and visas if they break the law. The agency emphasized that advocating violence, supporting terrorism, or encouraging such activities will result in ineligibility to remain in the U.S.

title: 19 vehicles in MP CM Mohan Yadav‚Äôs convoy towed after water filled in tank
content: A significant disruption occurred in Ratlam when at least 19 vehicles in Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav's convoy broke down after refueling at a local petrol pump. The vehicles were reportedly filled with diesel contaminated with water, leading to their breakdown and subsequent towing.

title: Kolkata gangrape: NCW takes cognisance; BJP, TMC clash with each other
content: A female student was allegedly gang-raped at South Calcutta Law College, leading to the arrest of three individuals‚Äîtwo former students and a staff member. The incident, which occurred on June 25, has sparked outrage and a political clash, with the BJP accusing the TMC of enabling a culture of impunity.

title: Kolkata shocker: Student raped on law college premises; staffer among 3 arrested
content: A student reported a rape incident at a Kolkata law college. Police acted swiftly, arresting three individuals. The accused are Manojit Mishra, Zaib Ahmed, and Pramit Mukhopadhyay. One is accused of the assault, while the others allegedly abetted the crime. They will appear in court in Alipore. Police seek custody for further investigation. The victim's identity remains protected.

title: Jaishankar thanks Iran for helping evacuate Indians amid Israel conflict
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar thanked Iran for aiding the safe evacuation of Indian nationals during the recent conflict with Israel. Operation Sindhu, launched on June 18, has brought home over 4,400 Indians via 19 special flights from Iran and Israel. Evacuations occurred from cities like Mashhad, Yerevan, and Ashgabat, even including some nationals from Nepal and Sri Lanka.

title: Union minister backs RSS call to review ‚Äòsocialist‚Äô, ‚Äòsecular‚Äô in Preamble
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has criticized PM Modi and Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, alleging a conspiracy to remove poor voters from electoral rolls through the Election Commission's special revision. He questions the timing and feasibility of creating a new voter list just before elections.

title: IND vs ENG: India resume training ahead of 2nd Test; Bumrah sits out net session
content: Following their Headingley defeat, the Indian cricket team has commenced preparations for the second Test against England in Birmingham. Despite Jasprit Bumrah's presence, he refrained from on-field activities, while Prasidh Krishna was also absent from bowling drills. Coach Gautam Gambhir engaged in discussions with pacers, and players participated in net sessions.

title: 'Wanted to kill Khamenei but ...': Israel reveals how Ayatollah evaded assassination
content: During the recent conflict, Israeli defence minister Israel Katz revealed that Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was a target for assassination but evaded capture by going into hiding. Despite this, Israel launched airstrikes, killing Iranian commanders and nuclear scientists, aiming to destabilize Iran's leadership.

title: Watch: Elephants go on rampage at Jagannath Rath Yatra in Gujarat
content: During the Rath Yatra celebrations in Ahmedabad, a male elephant became agitated. The incident occurred near Desai ni Pol in Khadia. Authorities swiftly administered a tranquilizer injection. Female elephants helped to herd the male elephant away. No injuries were reported, and the crowd was quickly controlled. The male elephant is now isolated. The remaining 17 female elephants continued the procession.

title: Kolkata horror: TMC, BJP trade barbs over rape case in law college
content: A rape case at a Kolkata law college has sparked political controversy. Trinamool Congress (TMC) blames Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) for delaying the Aparajita Anti-Rape Bill. BJP accuses the Mamata Banerjee government of inaction due to political reasons. Three men, including students and staff, have been arrested in connection with the incident.

title: 'We were told there was a threat': Rohit Sharma spills secrets of IND vs PAK clash
content: Rohit Sharma recalls the electrifying atmosphere surrounding India-Pakistan matches, describing it as a festival-like experience. He lauded Rishabh Pant's crucial innings and the exceptional bowling performance of Jasprit Bumrah and Arshdeep Singh in the T20 World Cup clash. Sharma emphasized the strategic use of Bumrah and Arshdeep to defend a low total on a challenging pitch.

title: ≈öwiƒÖtek and Azarenka caught in feud as ‚Äòawkward‚Äô handshake breaks the internet
content: A frosty handshake between Iga ≈öwiƒÖtek and Victoria Azarenka after their match at the French Open has ignited speculation among tennis fans. The brief, cold exchange, devoid of smiles or eye contact, contrasted sharply with the players' usual professionalism. While the reason remains unclear, the moment has become a major talking point, highlighting the intense emotions of elite competition.

title: After suspending Indus Treaty with Pak, India considers revising Ganges Treaty with B'desh
content: India is considering revising the Ganges Water Sharing Treaty with Bangladesh, set to expire in 2026. New Delhi seeks a new treaty reflecting its current irrigation, port maintenance, and power generation needs.

title: Mussolini returns to Rome! Italian dictator's great grandson signs for Italian football club
content: Lazio has recalled Romano Floriani Mussolini, great-grandson of Benito Mussolini, after his loan at Juve Stabia, where he made 37 appearances. Despite Juve Stabia's interest in a permanent deal, Lazio opted to bring back the 22-year-old right back. Fascist fan groups are prevalent in Italian football, with Lazio's supporters having ties to the extreme right.

title: Former Andhra Pradesh CM Jagan Reddy gets court relief in convoy death case
content: The Andhra Pradesh High Court has temporarily shielded YS Jagan Mohan Reddy, former Chief Minister and YSRCP chief, from coercive police action in connection with a case involving the death of a party worker. This occurred during a political tour when a vehicle from Reddy's convoy fatally struck a man.

title: Hailee Steinfeld drops jaws while living her best ‚Äòwife life‚Äô with Josh Allen
content: Hailee Steinfeld is currently honeymooning in the Maldives with Josh Allen, showcasing a series of stunning all-white designer outfits. The actress and musician, who recently married, shared images of herself in Cult Gaia ensembles, including a feathered gown and a pliss√© top with a skirt. She also promoted her Angel Margarita cocktail brand while enjoying the tropical scenery.

title: From stop clock to boundary catches: ICC makes multiple big changes to cricket rules
content: The ICC has introduced significant changes to cricket playing conditions across all formats, including Test, ODI, and T20I. A stop clock will be permanently implemented in Test cricket to address over rates, while ODI ball usage is modified to manage wear and tear.

title: 'Tea by the sea': West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's photo with monkey goes viral - see pics
content: West Bengal's Chief Minister, Mamata Banerjee, recently captivated social media users with heartwarming images of her feeding a monkey. The photos, posted on her Instagram, show Banerjee offering biscuits to the calm animal while sitting on a pavement. Reportedly taken at Digha beach, the post has garnered significant attention.

title: 'Unacceptable': Japan condemns Trump's Hiroshima comparison to Iran strikes
content: Japan has strongly condemned Donald Trump's comparison of US strikes on Iran to the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki. Survivors and officials expressed outrage, with Nagasaki's mayor calling the comparison 'regrettable'. Hiroshima lawmakers passed a resolution rejecting any justification for nuclear weapons. Trump claimed the strikes 'obliterated' Iran's nuclear capabilities, contradicting intelligence assessments.

title: ‚ÄòOperation Narnia‚Äô and 'Red Wedding': How Israel pulled off 'Game of Thrones' on Iran
content: Israel executed strikes against Iran. The operation targeted military leaders and nuclear scientists. It is called 'Red Wedding' and 'Operation Narnia'. US support amplified the effect. Iran's nuclear infrastructure is damaged. Revolutionary Guard leadership is decimated. Israel exposed Iran's weak defenses. A ceasefire is in place. Future talks are uncertain. Iran may accelerate nuclear weaponization. The situation remains tense.

title: Caitlin Clark Sidelined by Injury: Major setback hits Indiana Fever
content: Caitlin Clark is out due to a left groin injury. This happened after a fall in a previous game. The Indiana Fever lost to the Los Angeles Sparks without her. The team is taking a cautious, day-to-day approach. An MRI was conducted. Her absence affects the Fever's offense. The team signed Aari McDonald to help the backcourt.

title: IND vs ENG ‚Äì Warning bells! 'To win in England, India have got to play Kuldeep Yadav'
content: Following India's underwhelming bowling performance in the first Test, former cricket stars Michael Clarke and Nick Knight have urged the inclusion of Kuldeep Yadav. Clarke criticized India's selection strategy, emphasizing the need to prioritize wicket-taking over bolstering batting depth.

title: Internal war in K'taka Cong? What CM Siddaramaiah said on minister's claim
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah dismissed claims of internal disputes and potential political shifts within the state government, refuting statements made by minister KN Rajanna. Rajanna had earlier hinted at possible changes after September due to multiple power centers within the Congress, fueling speculation of a cabinet reshuffle or even a change in CM.

title: Cash in hand, killers on call: Mother-daughter love triangle ends in husband‚Äôs killing
content: A newlywed man was murdered in a meticulously planned conspiracy orchestrated by his wife and her lover. The illicit affair fueled the crime, as they hired contract killers and used GPS tracking to monitor the victim's movements.

title: ‚ÄòSitaare Zameen Par‚Äô box office day 8: Movie crosses Rs 90 cr in first week
content: Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' has grossed over Rs 90 crore in its first week, a significant achievement for a film relying on positive word-of-mouth. While initial earnings were strong, the film experienced a slight decline mid-week. The movie faces competition from new releases like Kajol's 'Maa' and the South Indian film 'Kannapa', potentially impacting its future box office performance.

title: Congress takes jab at Centre as Trump teases 'great' trade deal with India
content: Amidst Donald Trump's announcement of an impending 'very big deal' with India, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has criticised the Centre, linking it to the 'abrupt' conclusion of Operation Sindoor. Trump's repeated claims of using trade discussions to halt India-Pakistan confrontations have been met with skepticism. Ramesh suggests India is learning about crucial decisions from Washington DC.

title: India-US trade deal: Energy, & low tariffs - what will be in 'very big' pact
content: Trade talks between India and the US are gaining momentum, potentially leading to a significant agreement. President Trump hinted at a "very big" deal to open up India, focusing on sectors like energy, agriculture, and defense.

title: 'Avoid new complexities': Rajnath's message to China after firm stance on terror
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh met his Chinese counterpart, Dong Jun, in Qingdao during the SCO Defence Ministers' Meeting, where they discussed the resumption of the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra. Suspended initially due to Covid-19 in 2020 and later due to the Galwan Valley clash, the pilgrimage is now set to resume. Singh also gifted Dong Jun a Madhubani painting from Bihar as a gesture of goodwill.

title: ‚ÄòLike H-1B without lottery‚Äô: What is O-1 visa? check details
content: The O-1 visa is gaining traction among professionals and companies as an alternative to the H-1B, offering a route to work in the US for those with extraordinary abilities. With rising O-1A approvals and a high success rate, STEM graduates, researchers, and artists are increasingly pursuing this option.

title: 'Never accepted Constitution': Congress hits back at RSS
content: Jairam Ramesh of Congress has strongly criticized the RSS for allegedly never accepting the Indian Constitution and attacking its framers. This response follows RSS general secretary Dattatreya Hosabale's remark questioning the inclusion of "Socialist" and "Secular" in the Constitution. Ramesh highlighted past calls by the RSS and BJP for a new Constitution, which he claims were rejected by the public.

title: 'Constitution in hand' politics: EAM mocks Rahul, blames 'family' for Emergency
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has criticised the Congress party and Rahul Gandhi for their alleged hypocrisy regarding constitutional values, pointing to their failure to apologise for the Emergency. He accused them of flashing the Constitution without truly respecting its spirit, highlighting the Emergency as a dark period where national spirit was suppressed.

title: US-China trade deal: After Trump, China says details of deal ‚Äòconfirmed‚Äô
content: The US and China have finalized a trade deal, with the US agreeing to cancel restrictive measures, according to China. This follows earlier discussions and a negotiation framework established in London. China is expediting rare earth export approvals, a crucial element in high-tech manufacturing, while both economies have faced negative impacts from trade tensions, including declining manufacturing profits and economic slowdown.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal go up against Spurs for Eberechi Eze
content: arsenal have stepped up their efforts to beat rivals Tottenham Hotspur in the race for Eberechi Eze . if Christian Nrgaard is a suitable replacement for Thomas Partey, join us for the latest transfer news, rumors, and gossip from around the globe . moretto - ajax working on details of deal to sign winger Ral Moro .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Trade grades: Mammoth get an A+ for Peterka addition
content: the Utah Mammoth could add at least one top-six forward to their roster . if the Sabres would part ways with restricted free agent JJ Peterka, we'll look at how both front offices performed in this swap . in 2024-25, the Utah Hockey Club was a top-10 team in terms of shot share and shots per 60 minutes rate .

title: Bradley's take: Will Paul's hook land better than Julio C√©sar Ch√°vez Jr.'s?
content: a 10-round cruiserweight bout against former middleweight champion Julio Cesar Chavez Jr. will be his 13th pro fight of 2025 . this will be Paul's first pro fight against a former boxing champ other than last November's fight against the then 58-year-old Mike Tyson . Chavez has fought only once since 2021 .

title: Can Ilia Topuria do everything left on his UFC to-do list by 30?
content: Ilia Topuria, now 28, is ranked no. 2 on the pound-for-pound list . he is fast-becoming one of the sport's biggest stars . topuria will look to become a two-weight champion on sunday .

content: my team grades for the 2025 draft are the only ones you'll read that aren't concerned with results . no team, not even the Brooklyn Nets, drafts enough players in one year . trades are also considered .

title: NBA trade tracker: Live updates during the 2025 draft
content: the 2025 offseason is here, and deals are getting done . on the last day of the season, the Phoenix Suns traded MVP Kevin Durant to the Houston Rockets for Jalen Green and Dillon Brooks . the grizzlies moved guard Desmond Bane to the Orlando Magic for a package of players .

title: Best picks, surprising moves and top trades: Making sense of Round 1
content: the 2025 draft began with the first of three players selected by the Dallas Mavericks . it ended with the LA Clippers drafting center Yanic Konan Niederhauser with pick no. 30 . the Phoenix Suns landing the top-ranked center in Duke's Khaman Maluach .

title: NBA free agency 2025: Latest signings, news, buzz, live reports
content: the new york Knicks are still looking for a head coach . the Boston Celtics are dramatically reshaping their roster . a multiplayer, multipick deal tipped off the trade season with the Orlando Magic . our insiders will be tracking latest signings .
